page.title: 11LONGNOR HALL FARM
page.content: ONE AFTERNOON WE WENT TO LONGNOR HALL FARM.WE MET THE FARMERS WIFE,MRS HOLT WHO TOLD US THAT HER HUSBANDS FAMILY HAD LIVED AT THE HALL FOR 60 YEARS. LONGNOR HALL IS A GEORGIAN HOUSE BUILT IN ABOUT 1720.IT HAS 19 ROOMS NOT INCLUDING HALLS AND PASSAGES.THE OAK STAIRCASE WAS ADDED IN 1890 AND DURING THE FIRST WORLD A MOSAIC FLOOR WAS LAID IN THE HALL BY PRISONERS OF WAR. THIS YEAR ON THE FARM THEY HAD 52 EWES AND 100 LAMBS.THEY GET APPROX.53000L.OF MILK FROM 93 FRIESIAN COWS.WE SAW THE MILKING PARLOUR AND THE ELECTRIC MILKING MACHINES.THERE WERE 2 BULLS,12 HENS,4 COLLIES AND A PONY AS WELL. THEY HAVE 292 ACRES MOST OF WHICH IS PASTURE.THEY GROW WHEAT,BARLEY,CORN AND HAY.THEY HAVE A LARGE VEGETABLE GARDEN IN WHICH WE SAW FRUIT TREES,CABBAGES PEAS,POTATOES,ONIONS LETTUCE AND BEANS. MRS HOLT NEVER BUYS FRESH VEGETABLES.
